content.description: I don't know if this is new but it's an ok warmup for Jolly Roger and kind of fun. So if you're going up there there are a couple of other things around.
content.location: Smaller boulder directly uphill of Jolly Roger.

content.description: I started in a right hand gaston and a very cool left hand gas pocket in a mini hueco. Move up and follow the crack back left to top out. Lichenous.
content.location: This boulder is in the area with a bunch of logs below Jolly Roger. Holds at least two other problems.

content.description: Awesome compression moves to a desperate toss to a good hold.
content.location: This one is somewhat difficult to describe.... From the hole show hike west and continue past haunt-a-crack slightly uphill via a rock slab. Make your way up towards The queen bee. When you arrive at the cluster of warm up boulders trend down hill and you should find Osaputita. There are other ways to get there but this way excludes as much bush wacking as possible.

content.description: A sit start that tacks on a few thin moves to gain the start holds of Jolly Roger. Starts with a decent left hand flat edge in the tan streak and a good low right hand. Cool temps are nice for this one...
content.protection: Two pads minimum, three is nice.

content.description: Stand start on two opposing sidepull/underclings - make compression moves on incut crimps and finish on a delicate face on bomber rock.
content.location: This one is somewhat challenging to get to, but is a massive boulder and is visible from several parts of the canyon. From the main area hike up and left out of the drainage to an open area with large trees, look directly uphill and you should see the large striking boulder - pick your way through rocks and brush to it.

content.description: Start on the jug rail, move through some sloping nobs, then quest up the slab on fun chicken heads. Can also be done from the sit start.
content.protection: one pad, and another for there yucca patch to the right is nice.
content.location: Down hill side of Jolly Roger boulder. Pretty obvious.

content.description: I started R hand in a cool pinch o the right side of the arete, left hand in small pocket-crimp on the arete. Moved up and left to join the slanting crack.
content.location:
Right of the slanting crack

 The R hand pinch has some yellow sap in the right side of it. Hard to describe but obvious when you see it.
